currently RegistryCI parses the github status to see if automerge has passed and to therefore merge the PR: <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/RegistryCI.jl/blob/c8c16ff6da9e4bb84bb69b982501eb5a88ffe2bf/src/AutoMerge/cron.jl#L131-L132>. What if instead of using github statuses, AutoMerge adds a label “AutoMerge passed” or such, and then the cron job checks the label instead of the github status?

The advantage would be we could add that label manually so we don’t need the “needs manual merge in 3 days” label (and for someone to follow up).

This wouldn’t be a perfect solution, because if two things were blocking it (like a compat issue + a naming issue), then the human moderator shouldn’t add the “AutoMerge: passed” label (until e.g. the combat issue is resolved).
